isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTERS AND COOLER - OIL FILTERS AND HEADER - REASSEMBLY

step1.para:
Install the bypass valve and spring into the header. Refer to Figure 9.29
.
Using a new gasket, install the bypass valve plug and tighten to the specified special torque.

Using a new gasket, install the filter header assembly to the crankcase. Fasten the header using special "patch" bolts to assure proper sealing. Refer to Figure 9.27
. Tighten to the standard torque. (See Appendix.)
Reconnect the turbocharger oil inlet tube to the oil filter header elbow. Use a new sealing ring at the oil inlet tube nut.
Install two new lube oil filters as follows:

step2.para: Lubricate the filter gasket with clean engine oil.
Hand tighten the filters 1/2-3/4 turn after the gasket contacts the header. DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN.

note.para: For all engines built prior to S/N 567491, after installing two (2) new "EXTENDER™" oil filters, ADD one (1) extra 0.946 liter (quart) of oil. This will bring the total capacity of the lubrication system from 19 to 20 liters (20 to 21 quarts) for engines equipped with a rear sump pan and from 21 to 22 liters (22 to 23 quarts) for engines equipped with front sump oil pan. Dipstick oil level MUST be brought up to "FULL" mark.
